query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Quel color che viltà di fuor mi pinse 2 veggendo il duca mio tornare in volta, 3 più tosto dentro il suo novo ristrinse.
query.error: **English:** 1 That color which fear painted on my face 2 when I saw my leader turn back, 3 he quickly suppressed within his new appearance.
query.result: 1 Þæt blæc ðe me min mod gehyrde 2 ða ic ðone heretogan on hweorfe geseah, 3 he ða hraðe his hiw forgeaf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Attento si fermò com’ uom ch’ascolta; 5 ché l’occhio nol potea menare a lunga 6 per l’aere nero e per la nebbia folta.
query.error: **English:** 4 He stopped attentively like a man listening, 5 because his eyes could not lead him far 6 through the dark air and the thick fog.
query.result: 4 He stod ðær and hlyste swa swa mon ðe hlyst, 5 forðæm ðe his eagan ne mihton hine lædan feor 6 ðurh ðone sweartan lyft and ðone þiccan mist.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 «Pur a noi converrà vincer la punga», 8 cominciò el, «se non . . . Tal ne s’offerse. 9 Oh quanto tarda a me ch’altri qui giunga!».
query.error: **English:** 7 "Yet we must overcome the struggle," 8 he began, "if not . . . Such an offer was not made. 9 Oh, how long it seems to me until someone else arrives here!"
query.result: 7 "Þeah ðe us gelimpð ðæt we ðone wæl reafien," 8 ongan he cwæðan, "gif hit swa ne bið . . . Swylc ne æteowde. 9 Eala, me þynceð langsum ðæt ænig oder her cume!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 I’ vidi ben sì com’ ei ricoperse 11 lo cominciar con l’altro che poi venne, 12 che fur parole a le prime diverse;
query.error: **English:** 10 I saw very well how he covered up 11 the beginning with the other that came after, 12 which were words different from the first;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 ma nondimen paura il suo dir dienne, 14 perch’ io traeva la parola tronca 15 forse a peggior sentenzia che non tenne.
query.error: **English:** 13 but nevertheless his speech caused me fear, 14 because I drew from the truncated words 15 perhaps a worse meaning than they held.
query.result: 13 ac ðeah ðæs his worda wæs ege, 14 forðæm ic ða word to wærran dome teah 15 ðonne hi sylfe hæfdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 «In questo fondo de la trista conca 17 discende mai alcun del primo grado, 18 che sol per pena ha la speranza cionca?».
query.error: **English:** 16 "Into this depth of the woeful hollow 17 does anyone ever descend from the first circle, 18 who has only lost hope as punishment?".
query.result: 16 "On ðisne grund ðæs sarigean sadeles 17 astihð ænig of ðam forman geweorce, 18 ðe ðurh ðone wite ða wene forleas?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Questa question fec’ io; e quei «Di rado 20 incontra», mi rispuose, «che di noi 21 faccia il cammino alcun per qual io vado.
query.error: **English:** 19 This question I asked; and he replied to me, "Rarely 20 does it happen that anyone from our midst 21 takes the path that I am on.
query.result: 19 Þas axunge ic freah; he ða fusne me 20 andswarode, "Selden hit gelimped 21 ðæt ænig monna mæge ðone weg gewitan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Ver è ch’altra fïata qua giù fui, 23 congiurato da quella Eritón cruda 24 che richiamava l’ombre a’ corpi sui.
query.error: **English:** 22 It is true that I was once down here before, 23 summoned by that cruel Erichtho, 24 who called the shades back to their bodies.
query.result: 22 Hit is soð ðæt ic ær ðær wæs, 23 geciged ðurh ða wælhreowan Ericton, 24 ðe ða sawle eft ongean ða lichoman clypode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Di poco era di me la carne nuda, 26 ch’ella mi fece intrar dentr’ a quel muro, 27 per trarne un spirto del cerchio di Giuda.
query.error: **English:** 25 My flesh was almost naked, 26 when it made me enter within that wall, 27 to draw out a spirit from the circle of Judas.
query.result: 25 Min flæsc wæs næfre nacod, 26 ða hit me dyde in ðone weall gan, 27 ðæt ic ðær of ðam cyrre Iudan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Quell’ è ’l più basso loco e ’l più oscuro, 29 e ’l più lontan dal ciel che tutto gira: 30 ben so ’l cammin; però ti fa sicuro.
query.error: **English:** 28 That is the lowest and darkest place, 29 and the farthest from the heavens that turn everything: 30 I know the way well; therefore, be assured.
query.result: 28 Þæt is se læsta stede and se ðeorcosta, 29 and se feorresta fram ðam heofonum ðe eall bewegað: 30 ic cann ðone weg wel; forðy beo ðu getrymmed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Questa palude che ’l gran puzzo spira 32 cigne dintorno la città dolente, 33 u’ non potemo intrare omai sanz’ ira».
query.error: **English:** 31 This swamp which exhales the great stench 32 encircles the woeful city, 33 where we cannot now enter without wrath.
query.result: 31 Þeos fen ðe ðone miclan stenc spywð 32 ymb ða wælræste byrig, 33 ðær we ne magon in gangan butan yrre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 E altro disse, ma non l’ho a mente; 35 però che l’occhio m’avea tutto tratto 36 ver’ l’alta torre a la cima rovente,
query.error: **English:** 34 And he said other things, but I don’t remember them; 35 because my eyes had completely drawn me 36 toward the tall tower with its fiery peak,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 dove in un punto furon dritte ratto 38 tre furïe infernal di sangue tinte, 39 che membra feminine avieno e atto,
query.error: **English:** 37 where three infernal Furies, stained with blood, 38 suddenly appeared together in an instant, 39 who had the limbs andの姿of women,
query.result: 37 ðær ða ðreo helle hægstealdas, mid blode begotene, 38 ðærrihte wæron gearwe, 39 ða ðe wifhades wrixl and wlite hæfdon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 e con idre verdissime eran cinte; 41 serpentelli e ceraste avien per crine, 42 onde le fiere tempie erano avvinte.
query.error: **English:** 40 and they were girded with very green hydras; 41 they had little snakes and horned vipers for hair, 42 which entwined their fierce temples.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E quei, che ben conobbe le meschine 44 de la regina de l’etterno pianto, 45 «Guarda», mi disse, «le feroci Erine.
query.error: **English:** 43 And he, who well knew the handmaidens 44 of the queen of eternal weeping, 45 said to me, "Look, the fierce Erinyes.
query.result: 43 And se ðe wel cuðe ða mennen 44 ðære cwene ðæs ecan wopes, 45 "Loca," cwæð he, "ða wælhreowan Erinys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Con l’unghie si fendea ciascuna il petto; 50 battiensi a palme e gridavan sì alto, 51 ch’i’ mi strinsi al poeta per sospetto.
query.error: **English:** 49 With their nails they tore at their chests; 50 they beat their palms and cried out so loudly, 51 that I clung to the poet in fear.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 «Vegna Medusa: sì ’l farem di smalto», 53 dicevan tutte riguardando in giuso; 54 «mal non vengiammo in Tesëo l’assalto».
query.error: **English:** 52 "Let Medusa come: we will turn him to stone", 53 they all said, looking down; 54 "we did not avenge the assault on Theseus badly".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 «Volgiti ’n dietro e tien lo viso chiuso; 56 ché se ’l Gorgón si mostra e tu ’l vedessi, 57 nulla sarebbe di tornar mai suso».
query.error: **English:** 55 "Turn back and keep your eyes closed; 56 for if the Gorgon shows herself and you see her, 57 there would be no way to return above."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Così disse ’l maestro; ed elli stessi 59 mi volse, e non si tenne a le mie mani, 60 che con le sue ancor non mi chiudessi.
query.error: **English:** 58 Thus spoke the master; and he himself 59 turned me, and did not hold himself to my hands, 60 so that with his own he might not close me in again.
query.result: 58 Swa cwæð se mægester; and he me sylfne 59 gewende, and ne heold hine to minum handum, 60 ðæt he mid his agenum me ne beluce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 O voi ch’avete li ’ntelletti sani, 62 mirate la dottrina che s’asconde 63 sotto ’l velame de li versi strani.
query.error: **English:** 61 O you who have sound intellects, 62 consider the doctrine that is hidden 63 beneath the veil of the strange verses.
query.result: 61 Eala ġe ðe habbað ða gesunde geþohtas, 62 lociað ða lare ðe is behyd 63 under ðæm hleore ðara sellicra worda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 E già venìa su per le torbide onde 65 un fracasso d’un suon, pien di spavento, 66 per cui tremavano amendue le sponde,
query.error: **English:** 64 And now there came up over the murky waves 65 a crashing sound, full of terror, 66 at which both banks trembled,
query.result: 64 And ða com of ðæm gedrefedum yðum 65 sweg micel scipes, ðæs ðe sælidend 66 ofer cald wæter ceolum styredon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 non altrimenti fatto che d’un vento 68 impetüoso per li avversi ardori, 69 che fier la selva e sanz’ alcun rattento

query.result: 67 nalles elnes leas, ac ðurh egsan wæs 68 se hringedstefna gehladen hrædlice, 69 oððæt on sande sæmearh wæs

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 li rami schianta, abbatte e porta fori; 71 dinanzi polveroso va superbo, 72 e fa fuggir le fiere e li pastori.
query.error: **English:** 70 breaks the branches, knocks them down, and carries them away; 71 in front of it, dusty, it goes proudly, 72 and makes the wild animals and the shepherds flee.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Li occhi mi sciolse e disse: «Or drizza il nerbo 74 del viso su per quella schiuma antica 75 per indi ove quel fummo è più acerbo».
query.error: **English:** 73 He unsealed my eyes and said: "Now direct the nerve 74 of your sight over that ancient foam 75 toward where that smoke is most bitter."
query.result: 73 He mine eagan untýnde and cwæð: "Nu ðu scealt ðone sinew 74 ðines gesiho ofer ða ealdan sceame 75 þær ðær se smoca is bitrost."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Come le rane innanzi a la nimica 77 biscia per l’acqua si dileguan tutte, 78 fin ch’a la terra ciascuna s’abbica,
query.error: **English:** 76 Like frogs before their enemy, the snake, 77 scatter through the water, until each one hides on the ground,
query.result: 76 Swa ða froggan beforan ðære næddran 77 ðurh ðæt wæter wendon ða ða heo ðone wælhreow gesawon, 78 oððæt æghwylc ðara ðe ðær wæs on ðære eorðan læg,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 vid’ io più di mille anime distrutte 80 fuggir così dinanzi ad un ch’al passo 81 passava Stige con le piante asciutte.
query.error: **English:** 79 I saw more than a thousand ruined souls 80 fleeing in the same way from one who crossed 81 the Styx with dry feet.
query.result: 79 ða geseah ic ðær ðusenda monna sawla 80 fleonde beforan anum ðe ðurh ða Stygian mearc 81 mid ðrygum fotum feran meahte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Dal volto rimovea quell’ aere grasso, 83 menando la sinistra innanzi spesso; 84 e sol di quell’ angoscia parea lasso.
query.error: **English:** 82 From his face he removed that foul air, 83 often moving his left hand forward; 84 and he seemed weary only from that anguish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Ben m’accorsi ch’elli era da ciel messo, 86 e volsimi al maestro; e quei fé segno 87 ch’i’ stessi queto ed inchinassi ad esso.
query.error: **English:** 85 I realized well that he was sent from heaven, 86 and I turned to the master; and he made a sign 87 that I should be quiet and bow down to him.
query.result: 85 Ic wel ongeat ðæt he wæs of heofonum asend, 86 and ic me wende to ðæm mæstre; and he dyde tacn 87 ðæt ic sceolde beon gestille and ic sceolde to him gebigan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Ahi quanto mi parea pien di disdegno! 89 Venne a la porta e con una verghetta 90 l’aperse, che non v’ebbe alcun ritegno.
query.error: **English:** 88 Ah, how hateful it seemed to me! 89 He came to the gate and with a little rod 90 he opened it, for there was no resistance.
query.result: 88 Eala, hu micel ðuhte ðæt wæs to hatianne! 89 He com to ðære dura and mid anre gyrde 90 he ða ondyde, ðær nænig dyrstignæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 «O cacciati del ciel, gente dispetta», 92 cominciò elli in su l’orribil soglia, 93 «ond’ esta oltracotanza in voi s’alletta?
query.error: **English:** 91 "O you cast out from heaven, despised people," 92 he began on the horrible threshold, 93 "where does this arrogance in you find delight?
query.result: 91 "Eala, ge utdrifenan of heofonum, folc forðworpen," 92 ongann he sprecan on ðære egeslican ðyrscealde, 93 "hwanon is ðeos ofermodignys on eow geblissod?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Perché recalcitrate a quella voglia 95 a cui non puote il fin mai esser mozzo, 96 e che più volte v’ha cresciuta doglia?
query.error: **English:** 94 Why do you rebel against that will 95 whose end can never be cut off, 96 and which has increased your suffering many times over?
query.result: 94 Hwi winnað ge ongean ðone willan 95 ðæs ende ne mæg næfre beon ofasceacen, 96 and ðe oft and gelome hæfð eowre yrmða geeacnod?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Che giova ne le fata dar di cozzo? 98 Cerbero vostro, se ben vi ricorda, 99 ne porta ancor pelato il mento e ’l gozzo».
query.error: **English:** 97 What good does it do to struggle against fate? 98 Your Cerberus, if you remember correctly, 99 still carries his chin and throat peeled from it."
query.result: 97 Hwat fremað eow on ðære wyrde winnan? 98 Eower Cerberus, gif ge wel gemunan, 99 gyt bærð his cin and ðrote afyllede."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Poi si rivolse per la strada lorda, 101 e non fé motto a noi, ma fé sembiante 102 d’omo cui altra cura stringa e morda
query.error: **English:** 100 Then he turned back along the foul road, 101 and said not a word to us, but made a gesture 102 of one whom some other care constrains and goads,
query.result: 100 Þa he gewende hine on ða laðe stræt, 101 and ne spræc naht to us, ac he worhte gebær 102 ðæs mannes ðe hine oðer caru twingeð and biteð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 che quella di colui che li è davante; 104 e noi movemmo i piedi inver’ la terra, 105 sicuri appresso le parole sante.
query.error: **English:** 103 rather than of one who is concerned with the man 104 who is in front of him; and we moved our feet 105 confidently toward the land, following the holy words.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Dentro li ’ntrammo sanz’ alcuna guerra; 107 e io, ch’avea di riguardar disio 108 la condizion che tal fortezza serra,
query.error: **English:** 106 I entered there without any struggle; 107 and I, who had a desire to look at 108 the condition that such a fortress encloses,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 com’ io fui dentro, l’occhio intorno invio: 110 e veggio ad ogne man grande campagna, 111 piena di duolo e di tormento rio.
query.error: **English:** 109 as soon as I was inside, sent my eyes around: 110 and I see on every side a large plain, 111 full of sorrow and cruel torment.
query.result: 109 swa swa ic binnan wæs, ða sende ic ða eagan ymbe me: 110 and ic geseah on æghwylce healfe micelne feld, 111 fulne ðæs earfoðnysse and ðæs reðan tintregum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Sì come ad Arli, ove Rodano stagna, 113 sì com’ a Pola, presso del Carnaro 114 ch’Italia chiude e suoi termini bagna,
query.error: **English:** 112 Just as at Arles, where the Rhone becomes stagnant, 113 just as at Pola, near the Carnaro, 114 which encloses Italy and bathes its borders,
query.result: 112 Swa swa æt Ærle, þær Rodan stagnað, 113 swa swa æt Pola, wið þone Carnare, 114 þe Italie belocað and his endas baðað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 fanno i sepulcri tutt’ il loco varo, 116 così facevan quivi d’ogne parte, 117 salvo che ’l modo v’era più amaro;
query.error: **English:** 115 the sepulchers make the whole place uneven, 116 so they did here on every side, 117 except that the manner there was more bitter;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 ché tra li avelli fiamme erano sparte, 119 per le quali eran sì del tutto accesi, 120 che ferro più non chiede verun’ arte.
query.error: **English:** 118 for flames were spread among the tombs, 119 by which they were so completely kindled, 120 that no art demands hotter iron.
query.result: 118 forðæm betwux þam byrgenum fyras wæron todælede, 119 þurh þa wæron swa ealle onælede, 120 þæt nan cræft ne mæg nænne iren hatran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Tutti li lor coperchi eran sospesi, 122 e fuor n’uscivan sì duri lamenti, 123 che ben parean di miseri e d’offesi.
query.error: **English:** 121 All their coverings were suspended, 122 and from them issued such harsh laments, 123 that they clearly seemed to be from the wretched and the offended.
query.result: 121 Ealle heora hrof wæron ahongene, 122 and ðanon comon swa hefige heof, 123 ðæt hi wel licon wæron earme and gedrefede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 E io: «Maestro, quai son quelle genti 125 che, seppellite dentro da quell’ arche, 126 si fan sentir coi sospiri dolenti?».
query.error: **English:** 124 And I: "Master, who are those people 125 who, buried inside those tombs, 126 make themselves heard with their sorrowful sighs?"
query.result: 124 And ic: "Lareow, hwa sind ða leoda 125 ðe, bebyrgede innan ðam earcum, 126 hira swæran siccetunga cyðað?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 E quelli a me: «Qui son li eresïarche 128 con lor seguaci, d’ogne setta, e molto 129 più che non credi son le tombe carche.
query.error: **English:** 127 And those to me: "Here are the arch-heretics 128 with their followers, of every sect, and much 129 more than you believe are the tombs laden."
query.result: 127 And ða to me: "Her synd ða ealdras ðara gedwolena 128 mid heora gefolgenum, of ælce gedwylde, and swiðe 129 ma ðonne ðu gelyfe synd ða byrgena gehlædene."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Simile qui con simile è sepolto, 131 e i monimenti son più e men caldi». 132 E poi ch’a la man destra si fu vòlto,
query.error: **English:** 130 Like with like is buried here, 131 and the tombs are more or less elaborate. 132 And then, when he had turned to the right,
query.result: 130 Gelic mid gelicum is hēr bebyrged, 131 and ðā byrgena sind mā and læsse hāte». 132 And ðā ðā hē to ðǣre swīðran handa wæs gewend,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 passammo tra i martìri e li alti spaldi.
query.error: **English:** 133 we passed between the martyrs and the high ramparts.
query.result: 133 wē fērdon betwēon ðām martýrum and ðām hēan weallum.
